    #######TASK 
    Provide a factually correct and detailed textual description of the game compiled from the information presented above from different sources, in more than 1000 words.
            "Cap:": represents the captions published in the online portal usually within 30 seconds of the event.
            "E:" represents events recorded exactly after the event happened.
    Don't mention sources of information like commentators or captions, write as if you saw them live.
summary:
In a closely contested encounter at Santiago Bernabeu, Real Madrid battled their way to a hard-fought 2-1 victory over a determined Betis side. The match was marked by a sequence of intense moments, complete with tactical duels, dramatic goals, and a pivotal red card that swung the balance in favor of Los Blancos.

From the whistle, Real Madrid sought to stamp their authority on the game. They kicked off proceedings and began probing Betis’ defense. There was an early disruption just 24 seconds into the game as the ball went out of play, necessitating a throw-in from Real Madrid. This set the tone for a first half characterized by numerous interruptions and dead-ball situations.

Only a minute into the match, Betis committed a foul, gifting Real Madrid an indirect free-kick. However, early exchanges saw both teams struggle to maintain possession, with frequent throw-ins and clearances disrupting the game flow. Real Madrid got their first real opportunity in the sixth minute with a shot off target that whetted the appetite of their fans for what was to come.

Betis, resistant in defense, managed to clear their lines multiple times even as Real Madrid displayed their attacking intent. Their persistence paid off briefly when Morata took aim from the edge of the box, only to see his shot veer wide of the left post. Betis retaliated, showing they were not merely there to defend. Ruben Castro tested Keylor Navas with a similar effort that the goalkeeper comfortably handled.

The intricate dynamics of offside traps and defensive clearances dominated the middle portion of the first half. Real Madrid’s James Rodriguez found himself flagged for offside after an ambitious run, a testament to Betis tightening their defensive lines. Moments later, in an unexpected turn, Betis captured the lead in the 24th minute. Riza Durmisi slipped the ball to Antonio Sanabria, who coolly found the bottom right corner past Keylor Navas, stunning the home crowd into silence.

Stung by the goal, Real Madrid redoubled their efforts. They responded quickly and held onto possession, but had to contend with multiple fouls and an unyielding Betis defense. A turning point for Madrid came in the 29th minute when Cristiano Piccini earned a yellow card for a rough challenge. This indiscipline from Betis provided Madrid with additional set-piece opportunities.

Madrid’s resilience bore fruit just before the halftime break. Marcelo sent in a perfect lofted pass to Cristiano Ronaldo, who rose majestically to head home into the right side of the goal, leaving Betis goalkeeper Antonio Adan with no chance. The equalizing goal was a culmination of relentless pressure and tactical acumen from Zinedine Zidane’s men.

With the first half concluding at 1-1, players retreated to their dressing rooms to regroup. The second half resumed with Betis kicking off and both teams eager to tip the scales in their favor. Real Madrid displayed their offensive strategies right from the onset, taking immediate control. James Rodriguez, however, started with an inaccurate corner kick in the 2nd minute, underscoring the high-pressure stakes at play.

Betis too created early chances with Riza Durmisi's corner, only for the Real Madrid defense to stand firm. An exciting sequence saw Ruben Castro take a mid-range shot that sailed high over the bar, showing Betis’s intent to push forward even in the face of Madrid’s overwhelming possession stats.

The game ebbed and flowed with the intensity growing by the minute. A substitution by Betis in the 18th minute saw Petros coming in for Ruben Castro, signaling a tactical shift to bolster midfield stability. This substitution highlighted Betis' attempt to wrest back control, but it would not deter Real Madrid’s attacking might.

As the clock approached the latter stages of the match, tensions flared. A pivotal moment came in the 33rd minute when Cristiano Piccini, already on a yellow card, received his marching orders following a second bookable offense. Betis were reduced to ten men, significantly jeopardizing their defensive setup against a rampant Real Madrid.

This numerical advantage was soon exploited by the home team. Real Madrid won a corner in the 36th minute, and Toni Kroos sent a precise delivery into the box. Sergio Ramos, showcasing his aerial prowess, powered a header into the left side of the goal, sending the Bernabeu into raptures and setting the score at 2-1.

Betis, now at a disadvantage, continued to fight valiantly but struggled against Madrid's orchestrated defense and midfield orchestrations. Further substitutions saw Rafael Navarro replacing Aissa Mandi for Betis, and tactical swaps from both sides as they tried to maintain their momentum and counteract their rivals’ tactics.

As the match approached its final moments, Real Madrid sought to control possession and protect their lead. However, Betis got one last opportunity to equalize. Antonio Sanabria’s powerful header was impressively saved by Keylor Navas, epitomizing the goalkeeper’s crucial role in securing the win for Real Madrid.

In the end, Real Madrid's combination of tactical nous, persistent attacking play, and set-piece proficiency clinched the vital three points. Their ability to capitalize on Betis's defensive lapses, coupled with the tenacity in overpowering an initially resilient opponent, showcased why they are one of Europe’s elite football clubs.

The referee's final whistle marked the conclusion of a hard-fought victory for Real Madrid, with Santiago Bernabeu witnessing yet another thrilling encounter. Antonio Mateu Lahoz’s officiating came under stress, particularly with the issuing of a red card, but overall, the game underscored the dynamism and unpredictability inherent to the beautiful game.
